metadata.title: CVE-2016-10905 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in fs/gfs2/rgrp.c in the Linux kernel before 4.8. Ause-after-free is caused by the functions gfs2_clear_rgrpd andread_rindex_entry.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10905` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-165-generic - 4.4.0-165.193
linux-image-4.4.0-165-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-165.193
linux-image-4.4.0-165-lowlatency - 4.4.0-165.193
linux-image-4.4.0-165-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-165.193
linux-image-4.4.0-165-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-165.193
linux-image-4.4.0-165-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-165.193
linux-image-4.4.0-165-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-165.193
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-165-generic - 4.4.0-165.193
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-165-lowlatency - 4.4.0-165.193
No subscription required

linux-image-4.8.0-36-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-4.8.0-36-generic-lpae - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-4.8.0-36-lowlatency - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.8.0-36-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1059-kvm - 4.4.0-1059.66
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1095-aws - 4.4.0-1095.106
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1030-aws - 4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.11.0-1009-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
linux-image-extra-4.11.0-1009-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-4.10.0-1004-gcp - 4.10.0-1004.4
linux-image-extra-4.10.0-1004-gcp - 4.10.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1007-oracle - 4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1123-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1123.132
No subscription required

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-165.193').
linux-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1059.66').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1095.106').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.11.0-1009.9').
linux-gcp package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.10.0-1004.4').
linux-oracle package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1123.132').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1127.135').
